item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#967)—Clues and Answers for Monday, February 2
item.content:encoded:
It’s Monday, and while it’s time for a new week in your world, it’s also time for a new NYT Connections puzzle. I know you love them! But I also know you sometimes want to get the best NYT Connections hints squared away as soon as possible to start your day. That’s why I’ve outlined the answers and solutions below, just for you!

Read on to quickly resolve today’s NYT Connections puzzle.

What is NYT Connections?

It would be remiss of me not to give a little foundational backstory before leaping into today’s NYT Connections clues and hints.

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing New York Times lineup. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available to users worldwide and can be played on either desktop devices or via a mobile app.

Playing NYT Connections on your commute or while waiting for a coffee is a fantastic way to kill a few minutes.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

It’s relatively simple, and that’s why it’s the best New York Times game, in my opinion.

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words might have a double meaning, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty from least to most difficult, too.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (February 2)

If you want to figure out today’s NYT Connections clues without getting the answers outright, I’ll start with the words themselves. Perhaps just seeing the words here will prompt your brain to take action, and you’ll spot the trends immediately.

Here are the NYT Connections words from today’s puzzle, #967:

  • POPULAR
  • PERIOD
  • CROSS
  • STAMP
  • SPAN
  • PSALM
  • PASS
  • RYAN
  • LANYARD
  • STRETCH
  • REACHER
  • MARPLE
  • FAIR
  • INTERVAL
  • WRISTBAND
  • BOSCH

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow – Words you’d use to describe how long something lasts.
  • Green – Items that let you prove you belong somewhere — concerts, events, secure areas.
  • Blue – Last names of lead characters from popular thriller/crime novels and TV adaptations.
  • Purple – Each word becomes a type of tree when you add or remove a single letter.

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, February 2:

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers Explained for Today, February 2 (#967)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

  • Yellow – INTERVAL, PERIOD, SPAN, STRETCH
  • Green – LANYARD, PASS, STAMP, WRISTBAND
  • Blue – BOSCH, CROSS, REACHER, RYAN
  • Purple – FAIR, MARPLE, POPULAR, PSALM

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That’s today’s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that’s your local time). You’ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server

item.title: Escape from Tarkov Anti-Cheat Plea Gaining Community Traction
item.content:encoded:
Escape from Tarkov has long had an issue with cheaters, and the developer in Battlestate Games has always professed how much of a full-time job it is to constantly combat them. For every head you eviscerate, two more pop up – it’s that adage linked to the concept of the hydra, but in this case, the mythical monster is very real, and it concerns malicious gamers.

Recently, a new community-backed initiative (or plea) has started gaining traction within the Escape from Tarkov space. Long-term fans of the hardcore extraction title are requesting that Battlestate Games implement PlaySafe ID verification, echoing a successful move made recently by SCUM’s developer.

Could PlaySafe ID Change the Game in Escape from Tarkov?

PlaySafe ID is all about anti-cheat mechanics and player protection, encouraging the facilitation of verified matchmaking features that link legitimate players with other legitimate players. The technical infrastructure behind it is much more complex than that, but the long and short of it is that it works as an anti-cheat solution and is not disruptive.

In a trending suggestion on the Tarkov Community site, which regularly hosts player-backed initiatives ranked by user votes, it has been requested that Battlestate Games ‘finally beat cheaters with PlaySafe ID’.

At the time of writing, the suggestion had pulled in 153 total votes, of which 93% are in favor of the recommendation. In the comments, users spoke positively of PlaySafe ID and the potential protection gains the company could provide if it were to join forces with Battlestate Games.

The suggestion reads:

This isn’t about punishing legit players — it’s about finally protecting them. At this point, a system like PlaySafe ID feels like the only solution that can actually work long-term.

So, after the successful rollout of PlaySafeID in SCUM, it’s time to seriously talk about bringing it to Escape from Tarkov.

Let’s finally get rid of cheaters, that have plagued us since the alpha of this game

PlaySafe ID started probing the Escape from Tarkov space back in June 2025, revealing an interest in working with the developers to improve the state of play in the world’s biggest extraction shooter title.

In August 2025, the company backed an investigative report and survey that revealed that more than 80% of gamers had encountered cheating in an online game. It’s no big secret that Escape from Tarkov is one of the most troubled games in that respect.

Do you think you’d participate in what PlaySafe ID could offer in Escape from Tarkov? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Black Ops 7 Ranked Play changes are coming soon

item.title: Black Ops 7 Ranked Play Changes Make Things Harder As You Go Higher
item.content:encoded:
During the Call of Duty League Major I finals in Dallas, Treyarch took to the stage to present the future of Ranked Play in Black Ops 7. Next week, the more competitive ecosystem will be introduced to Black Ops 7, allowing players to flex their skills, unlock exclusive rewards, and climb the ranks.

However, in a brief interview, Treyarch explained that changes coming to Black Ops 7’s Ranked Play platform mean that the higher the rank you are, the harder time you will have, for multiple reasons.

Ranked Play Restrictions on Higher Levels

Treyarch appeared in Dallas, Texas, during the CDL Major I grand final to dish the dirt on Black Ops 7’s season two update, scheduled to drop next week. The conversation turned to the imminent arrival of Ranked Play and the changes that have been made to the competitive ecosystem.

First, it was confirmed that placement matches are being overhauled. The system will start calculating your opening rank from your first placement match, and after you’ve won three matches, you’ll be assigned an amount of SR and a starting rank that doesn’t put you at the lowest level out of the gate.

It was then explained that, as you climb the ranks, things get harder. If you make it into the top 250, the most prestigious annals of the Ranked Play platform, you’ll face immense losses when you fail to win your matches. You’ll drop harsher in terms of SR than you would at lower levels, keeping things much more competitive.

Also, you will not be able to queue with more than two Crimson-or-above-ranked players in one party. This is another limitation imposed to keep things more balanced.

Treyarch also confirmed that new ‘Ranked Play Series’ circuits will start up as season two unfolds. This fresh system will stand at the end of the season, allowing users to directly compete against those who finished ‘close to them’ in the Ranked Play space for more rewards and ‘the ultimate bragging rights.’

Do you think these changes are good, or are they putting you off playing Ranked? Let us know your Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that COR3’s first trailer has been released

item.title: AdHoc Working With Nintendo After Dispatch Censorship Controversy
item.content:encoded:
AdHoc says they’re working closely with Nintendo to find a pathway forward after a censored version of Dispatch was released on the Nintendo Switch 2.

Dispatch is a superhero interactive fiction video game in which your choices determine how the story unfolds. The game was released in the latter half of 2025 on PlayStation, Xbox, and PC. The game was instantly met with critical acclaim and fanfare.

Dispatch eventually made its way to Nintendo Switch 2, but instead of allowing some adult language and content to be censored, the decision was made for you, and the game is permanently censored on the Nintendo Switch.

Nintendo’s Response and AdHoc’s Current Stance

AdHoc initially responded to the backlash by explaining that different platforms have different submission criteria. They also stated that they worked with Nintendo to ensure the content met release criteria and assured players that the core narrative of the gameplay experience remained unchanged.

Nintendo then released a statement confirming that while they inform Partners when a submitted game does not meet their platform’s guidelines, they do not make changes to partners’ content.

AdHoc most recently stated in a Discord message that, like most players, they assumed they could access uncensored mature content on Nintendo Switch because games like The Witcher 3 and Cyberpunk 2077 are also available on the platform.

However, they’re continuing to work with Nintendo on a path forward. Still, they advise players to expect and update their addresses; at least some of the censored content will take weeks due to development time and the console submission process.

“People have a right to be pissed. Lots of lessons learned here. Thanks for sticking with us. More soon.”

Are you waiting for these changes to be addressed to play Dispatch on the Nintendo Switch, or are you more content playing on another platform? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1689: Hints and Answer for February 2, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1689 for February 2, 2026

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, February 2, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1689 is quite the challenge. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 5.3 of 6 guesses. That makes it harder than the 4-guess average from February 1.

General Wordle Hints For February 2

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word refers to a tangible object, not an action or quality.
  • Hint 2: It’s commonly associated with leisure or ritual.
  • Hint 3: The word often appears in social or cultural contexts.
  • Hint 4: You’ll frequently see it mentioned in movies or novels.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1689 for February 2, 2026.

Starter Words For February 2, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • IRATE
  • CHAIR
  • CABLE
  • GRAIN

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1689 On February 2, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: CIGAR

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

CIGAR is a noun that means “a more or less cylindrical roll of tobacco cured for smoking, of any of various lengths, thicknesses, degrees of straightness, etc., usually wrapped in a tobacco leaf.”

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1688 on February 1, 2026

Answer: SPINY

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1689?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on February 3 will be Wordle Game #1690.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…

item.title: First Trailer Released for ‘COR3’, An Upcoming Sci-Fi Shooter From Tarkov’s Developer
item.content:encoded:
COR3CORP has released a first-look trailer for COR3, a mysterious sci-fi FPS that has some kind of tie to Battlestate Games’ Nikita Buyanov. For more than a decade, Nikita Buyanov has been the head of the studio at Battlestate, spearheading the creation of Escape from Tarkov, arguably the most impactful extraction shooter ever made.

Despite being little more than a minute long, the first trailer for COR3 tells us plenty. It’s a first-person, sci-fi apocalypse title set on Mars. Or at least, that’s what we can glean from the minuscule look at the trailer, which you can see below.

What is COR3 and Why is it Exciting?

COR3 is the first project not associated with Escape from Tarkov that Nikita Buyanov has touted for many years. In the run-up to the trailer being dropped, weeks of teasers, cryptic posts, and puzzling websites surfaced across social media.

Interested users were presented with an interactive website that offered lore and a bit of backstory behind COR3, which is what we assume to be the game’s title. That’s still unclear.

The website presented a post-apocalyptic environment, putting players in the shoes of an investigator with a few pieces of rudimentary equipment at their disposal, probing systems to solve minor, gamified puzzles. It’s steeped in mystery, and even though the first trailer has been released, nobody knows what on Earth (or Mars) they’re looking at.

Here’s the trailer for your perusal:

We’re calling it COR3 because that’s the only title we’ve been given thus far. But the name of the video is PRJRPNT_BLUEMARS_FO, which could be a nod to a potential title. Project Repent: Blue Mars?

It’s impossible to say at this point, as we have almost nothing to go on. It’s now time for internet sleuths to start probing the trailer for some sign of what comes next, as the site that was hosting the countdown to the trailer dropping now shows… Well, the trailer.

As the short video opens, we see a first-person perspective, quite reminiscent of Escape from Tarkov in how the character moves and interacts with their weapon, manufactured by ‘Kalash Corp’, and then the camera peels back from ‘Mariner City’ in a ruined state and scales back across Mars.

We go into the clouds, and then eventually into the cosmos, past a space elevator and beyond ruined ships, into the midst of cosmonauts adrift in the great beyond. It’s not ‘astronauts’ here, as the outfits the ill-fated space adventurers are wearing are unmistakably Russian in origin, emblazoned with a red star.

Are you curious to know what comes next for COR3? Let us know what your theories are about this project on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that The Last of Us could end after one more season
